Package etomica.space

Class Space

  • java.lang.Object
    • etomica.space.Space
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Space1D, Space2D, Space3D

    public abstract class Space
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Superclass for all Space instances. Space classes are factories for vectors, tensors, etc.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Space getInstance​(int D)
        Parameters:
        D - the dimension of the requested space instance
        Returns:
        a space instance of the given dimension, which must be 1, 2, or 3.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if D is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • D

        public abstract int D​()
        Returns:
        the dimension of this space.

      • getD

        public int getD​()

      • rootD

        public abstract double rootD​(double a)
        Returns:
        the given value raised to the power 1/D, where D is the dimension of the space.

      • powerD

        public abstract int powerD​(int a)
        Returns:
        the given value raised to the Dth power, where D is the dimension of the space.

      • powerD

        public abstract double powerD​(double a)
        Returns:
        the given value raised to the Dth power, where D is the dimension of the space.

      • makeVector

        public abstract Vector makeVector​()
        Returns:
        a new Vector appropriate to the space.

      • makeOrientation

        public abstract IOrientation makeOrientation​()
        Returns:
        a new Orientation appropriate to the space.

      • makeTensor

        public abstract Tensor makeTensor​()
        Returns:
        a new Tensor appropriate to the space.

      • makeRotationTensor

        public abstract RotationTensor makeRotationTensor​()
        Returns:
        a new RotationTensor appropriate to the space.

      • makeArrayD

        public abstract int[] makeArrayD​(int i)
        Returns:
        an array of dimension D (as defined for this Space instance), with each element equal to the given value.

      • makeArrayD

        public abstract double[] makeArrayD​(double d)
        Returns:
        an array of dimension D (as defined for this Space instance), with each element equal to the given value.

      • sphereVolume

        public abstract double sphereVolume​(double r)
        The "volume" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D, this is twice the radius; in 2-D the area of the circle; in 3-D the volume of the sphere.
        Parameters:
        r - the radius
        Returns:
        the volume

      • sphereArea

        public abstract double sphereArea​(double r)
        The surface "area" of the "sphere" defined in the D-dimensional space. In 1-D this is zero; in 2-D the circumference of the circle; in 3-D the surface area of the sphere.
        Parameters:
        r - the sphere radius
        Returns:
        the area

      • makeVector

        public static Vector makeVector​(int D)
        Returns a Vector from the space of the given dimension.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if D is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • makeVector

        @Deprecated
public static Vector makeVector​(double... a)
        Deprecated. use Vector.of(double...)
        Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array. Spatial dimension of the Vector is determined by the length of a.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if a.length is not 1, 2, or 3.

      • makeVector

        @Deprecated
public static Vector makeVector​(int... k)
        Deprecated. use Vector.of(int...)
        Returns a Vector initialized to the given set of values in the array (cast to double). Spatial dimension of the Vector is determined by the length of a.

      • makeVectorArray

        public Vector[] makeVectorArray​(int n)
        Makes an array of Vectors.
        Parameters:
        n - number of vectors in the returned array
        Returns:
        an array of n new vectors made by this Space instance
